#summary How to install overplayed in Windows.

= System Requirements =

   * *Windows 7* or *8*, *32-bit* or *64-bit* has been tested, but the server should work on any version of Windows that PPJoy Supports

   * *PPJoy* installed with at least *one virtual joystick* created.

= PPJoy installation =

PPJoy is a virtual joystick that the server uses to send game controller input to games and applications. 

Website: http://ppjoy.bossstation.dnsalias.org/ 

Blog: http://ppjoy.blogspot.com/

Source repository: https://github.com/elitak/PPJoy

  * PPJoy can be downloaded at:
      * *32-bit*: http://ppjoy.bossstation.dnsalias.org/
      * *64-bit*: https://code.google.com/p/overplayed/downloads/detail?name=ppjoysetup-0-8-4-6.exe
          * *_Note 64-bit Windows Vista, 7, or 8, non-Ultimate only:_ Windows will be put in test mode upon installation.* It does not affect Windows except for a logo at the bottom right corner of the desktop. A helpful article explaining this can be found here: http://www.jim-melton.com/tag/ppjoy-windows-7-64-bit/ And the Microsoft knowledge base for reverting it can be found at: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2509241

  * After installation (only has to be done once):
      * Run *Configure Game Controllers*
      * Click *Add...*
      * Click *Add*
= Running overplayed server =
  * Download and run the overplayed server: https://code.google.com/p/overplayed/downloads/detail?name=Overplayed.exe

  * *Advanced:*
      * To change what port the server uses, use the port number as an argument when running the server, i.e. overplayed 12345.
      * Overplayed only uses UDP in case you want to port forward.

= Running overplayed =
  * overplayed client for Android can be downloaded at Google Play: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.gphrost.Overplayed
  * Enter the server's IP address or hostname and press *Start*
  * To enter text or to touch behind a control in an app behind overplayed press the 'Hide' button. Press it again to bring the controls back.
  * To quit, hide the controls and press *Quit*.
